item.title: Fiber Optic DWDM Up to 100 Gbps Per Wavelength
item.description: The demand for bandwidth keeps increasing, even during economic slowdowns. The main reason is the huge popularity of video, especially high-definition video, which needs a lot of bandwidth on all types of networks. Now, fiber optic systems using DWDM (Dense Wavelength Division Multiplexing) can handle 100 Gbps per wavelength. It seems like just yesterday we were excited about moving from 10 Gbps to 40 Gbps channels. Now, Alcatel-Lucent offers an upgrade that handles both 40 Gbps and 100 Gbps on a single optical carrier for their 1830 Photonic Service Switch (PSS).
